description: Brandwatch Listen enables comprehensive social media monitoring and analysis through advanced search queries, real-time alerts, and detailed analytics across multiple social platforms.

user_flows.name: Creating a Quick Search
user_flows.description: Create a new search to preview mentions matching your query
prerequisites: Access to Brandwatch Listen
Social Media Management user account

steps.action: Navigate to Quick Search tab in Listen
steps.details: Access the main Listen interface
Select from: Simple word/phrase, Guided Search, or Advanced Query
decision_points: Simple search: Enter brand, person, event, handle, topic, or hashtag
Guided search: Use structured fields for Brand, Issue, Campaign, Person, or Topic
Advanced query: Use Boolean operators and search operators

steps.details: Input search terms (max 600 characters for Quick Search)
Hit Enter or click Search button
View last month of mentions and basic analytics

expected_outcomes: Option to refine or save search available
limitations: Limited to last month of data
source_documents: Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Saving Searches.pdf
Listen/Getting Started/Introduction to Listen.pdf

user_flows.name: Saving a Quick Search as Saved Search
user_flows.description: Convert a Quick Search to a Saved Search for full functionality
prerequisites: Existing Quick Search with satisfactory results
User role of Team Leader or Admin
Available Saved Search slots in organization contract

steps.details: Ensure search query produces desired mentions
Located in top right of interface
Enter name, select team, add optional description
Click Save button to confirm

expected_outcomes: Search saved to Saved Searches tab
Full year of historical data accessible
source_documents: Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Saving Searches.pdf
Listen/Getting Started/Quick Search vs. Saved Search.pdf
Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Managing Listen Email Alerts.pdf
Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Saving Searches.pdf
citations: Listen/Getting Started/Quick Search vs. Saved Search.pdf

user_flows.name: Building Advanced Queries with Search Operators
user_flows.description: Create sophisticated searches using Boolean operators and content/source operators
prerequisites: Understanding of search operators
Clear search objectives
Knowledge of target content sources

steps.details: Determine keywords, exclusions, sources, and demographics needed
Use quotations, AND, OR, NOT, parentheses, tilde, brackets, wildcards, etc.
Specify sites, URLs, authors, subreddits, etc.
Filter by continent, country, region, city, or coordinates
Run Quick Search to validate results before saving

source_documents: Listen/Getting Started/Building Advanced Queries in Listen.pdf
Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Managing Listen Email Alerts.pdf
citations: Listen/Getting Started/Building Advanced Queries in Listen.pdf

user_flows.name: Setting Up Content Sources
user_flows.description: Add owned and non-owned social accounts, pages, and hashtags as targeted data sources
prerequisites: User role of Team Leader or Admin
Social account credentials for owned sources
Available content source slots (up to 1,000)

steps.details: Click cog icon in top-right corner of Listen
Select from owned/non-owned Facebook Pages, Instagram accounts, LinkedIn Pages, TikTok accounts, or Instagram hashtags
Connect Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, or TikTok accounts with proper permissions
Enter URLs, usernames, page names, or hashtags
decision_points: Owned sources: Require authentication and admin permissions
Non-owned sources: Can be added directly with URLs/usernames
Instagram hashtags: Limited to 30 per connected channel

steps.details: Set team access permissions and custom names if needed
Activate data collection for the source

expected_outcomes: Historical data available (365 days for most sources)
Source appears in Content Source Settings
limitations: Instagram hashtags: 30 per channel, cannot be deleted for 7 days
LinkedIn: Pulls all posts regardless of query due to privacy policy
source_documents: Listen/Getting Started/Tracking Content Sources in Listen.pdf
Listen/Interacting with Data/Viewing and Analyzing Listen Searches.pdf
citations: Listen/Getting Started/Tracking Content Sources in Listen.pdf

user_flows.name: Creating and Managing Email Alerts
user_flows.description: Set up automated email notifications for mention volume increases or new mentions
prerequisites: Existing Saved Search
User role of Team Leader or Admin

steps.details: Navigate to the search for which alerts are needed
Button located in top right of search interface
Enter descriptive name that will appear in email subject
Choose between volume increase alerts or new mention alerts
decision_points: Volume increase: Set percentage threshold for triggering
New mentions: Set frequency (hourly, daily, weekly) and timing

steps.details: Choose number of mentions to include in alert (default: 10)
Enter email addresses (can include non-users)
Recipients receive confirmation email with activation link

expected_outcomes: Automated emails sent based on configured triggers
Alert visible in email alerts management interface
management_actions: Edit: Modify name, type, frequency, recipients
source_documents: Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Managing Listen Email Alerts.pdf
Listen/Interacting with Data/Sentiment and Emotion Analysis.pdf
Listen/Interacting with Data/Mention Tags.pdf
citations: Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Managing Listen Email Alerts.pdf

user_flows.name: Filtering Search Results
user_flows.description: Apply filters to narrow down search results and focus analysis
prerequisites: Active Quick Search or Saved Search

steps.details: Click Filter icon on left-hand side of search interface
Choose from available filters based on search type
Select specific values or use include/exclude options
All graphs, metrics, and mentions update to reflect filter

steps.action: Adjust or clear filters as needed
steps.details: Deselect individual filters or use Clear All option

expected_outcomes: All visualizations update to show filtered data only
Filter count displayed on filter icon
source_documents: Listen/Interacting with Data/Filtering Searches in Listen.pdf
Listen/Interacting with Data/Mention Tags.pdf
citations: Listen/Interacting with Data/Filtering Searches in Listen.pdf

user_flows.name: Viewing and Analyzing Listen Mentions
user_flows.description: Examine individual mentions with detailed metadata and classifications
prerequisites: Active search with mention results

steps.details: Find mentions list on right-hand side of interface
Scroll through available mentions with preview information
Click on mention to view full information
Click timestamp to view mention on original platform
Use Sort By options: reach, newest/oldest first, random, retweets, impressions

expected_outcomes: Data for manual analysis and tagging
source_documents: Listen/Interacting with Data/Viewing Listen Mentions.pdf
Listen/Interacting with Data/Mention Tags.pdf
Listen/Interacting with Data/Ready to Use Social Panels in Listen.pdf

user_flows.name: Exporting Listen Data and Mentions
user_flows.description: Export mention data and insights for external analysis or reporting
prerequisites: Saved Search with data to export
Appropriate user permissions

steps.details: Access export functionality from mentions panel or insights section
Select time range and apply any desired filters
Choose appropriate format for intended use
Specify data fields and mention limits if applicable
Generate and download export file

expected_outcomes: Comprehensive data file for external analysis
Filtered data matching current search criteria
source_documents: Listen/Interacting with Data/Exporting Mentions in Listen.pdf
Listen/Interacting with Data/Viewing and Analyzing Listen Searches.pdf
citations: Listen/Interacting with Data/Exporting Mentions in Listen.pdf

user_flows.name: Using Guided Search for Brand Monitoring
user_flows.description: Create structured searches for brands, issues, campaigns, persons, or topics using guided interface
prerequisites: Clear understanding of search objective
Knowledge of relevant keywords and hashtags

steps.details: Choose from Brand, Issue, Campaign, Person, or Topic

steps.action: Enter search criteria in structured fields
steps.details: Add keywords and hashtags using comma separation
Specify terms that must be present in mentions
Specify terms to filter out from results
Listen automatically creates advanced query based on inputs
Click Search to view results
For brands, create additional searches within brand context

source_documents: Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Saving Searches.pdf
Listen/Interacting with Data/Filtering Searches in Listen.pdf

user_flows.name: Managing Mention Tags
user_flows.description: Create and apply custom tags to categorize mentions for better organization
prerequisites: Saved Search (tags not available in Quick Search)
User role of Team Leader or Admin for tag management

steps.details: Click on specific mention to expand full view
Look for 'Add tag' option in mention interface
Enter new tag name or choose from existing tags
Confirm tag assignment
Filter search results by applied tags for analysis

source_documents: Listen/Interacting with Data/Mention Tags.pdf
Listen/Interacting with Data/Filtering Searches in Listen.pdf

user_flows.name: Comparing Multiple Content Sources
user_flows.description: Compare performance and metrics across different owned social channels
prerequisites: Multiple content sources set up
Sufficient data across sources
Team access to all sources being compared

steps.details: Create search for one owned channel using Content Source Settings
Convert to Saved Search to enable multi-source comparison
Use 'Add Saved Search' or include additional sources during save process
Analyze metrics like sentiment, engagement, reach across channels
Use platform, timeframe, or other filters to focus analysis

expected_outcomes: Understanding of audience preferences by platform
source_documents: Listen/Listen - Additional Features/Comparing Multiple Listen Searches.pdf
citations: Listen/Listen - Additional Features/Comparing Multiple Listen Searches.pdf

user_flows.name: Setting Up Targeted Data Sources Authentication
user_flows.description: Authenticate social media accounts to enable tracking of owned content sources
prerequisites: Admin access to social media accounts
User role of Team Leader or Admin in Listen
Valid account credentials

steps.details: Select content source type that requires authentication
Click platform-specific connection button (Connect with Facebook, etc.)
Grant required permissions on social platform
Confirm successful authentication in Listen interface
Choose which pages/accounts from authenticated connection to monitor

expected_outcomes: Ability to track posts, comments, and engagement
troubleshooting: Ensure account has proper admin permissions
Check for special characters in organization names
Contact support if data doesn't appear within 1 hour
source_documents: Listen/Listen - Additional Features/Sources for Listen Mentions.pdf
citations: Listen/Listen - Additional Features/Sources for Listen Mentions.pdf

user_flows.name: Creating Shareable Report Links
user_flows.description: Generate public links to share Listen search results with external stakeholders
prerequisites: Saved Search with data to share
Appropriate permissions for external sharing

steps.details: Navigate to search intended for sharing
Look for sharing or report link functionality
Set timeframe, data visibility, and access permissions
Create public URL that doesn't require Login credentials
Share URL via email or other communication channels

expected_outcomes: External stakeholders can view search results
No Login required for link recipients
source_documents: Listen/Listen - Additional Features/Creating a Shareable Report Link in Listen.pdf
citations: Listen/Listen - Additional Features/Creating a Shareable Report Link in Listen.pdf

user_flows.name: Scheduling and Emailing Reports
user_flows.description: Set up automated delivery of Listen reports to stakeholders on recurring schedule
prerequisites: Saved Search with relevant data
User role of Team Leader or Admin
List of report recipients

steps.details: Navigate to reporting options within target search
Select data elements, timeframes, and format
Choose frequency: daily, weekly, monthly, or custom interval
Include internal team members and external stakeholders
Set subject line, message, and delivery time
Save configuration and enable automatic delivery

source_documents: Listen/Listen - Additional Features/Scheduling and Emailing Listen Reports.pdf
citations: Listen/Listen - Additional Features/Scheduling and Emailing Listen Reports.pdf

user_flows.name: Using Ready-to-Use Social Panels
user_flows.description: Access pre-built dashboard panels for common social media monitoring scenarios
prerequisites: Active Listen search with social media data
Understanding of panel objectives

steps.details: Navigate to Ready-to-Use Social Panels section
Choose panel matching analysis needs and data type
Connect panel visualization to current search data
Analyze pre-configured metrics and visualizations
Adjust timeframes, filters, or display options
Use panel data for reporting or further analysis

source_documents: Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Managing Listen Email Alerts.pdf
Listen/Getting Started/Creating and Managing Listen Email Alerts.pdf
citations: Listen/Interacting with Data/Ready to Use Social Panels in Listen.pdf
